title: Firefox 113 no funciona en Ubuntu 23.04
content:
Buenos días. Como he indicado, Firefox 113 no funciona en Ubuntu 23.04. Si lo hacía la última evolución del 112. Sin embargo, aunque en un principio se pueda instalar, por actualizaciones, por Ubuntu Software, por Terminal, o descargándolo directamente desde la página web oficial, solo funciona durante la sesión que lo instalo, en cuanto reinicio el sistema, aparece una página en negro que no consigo quitar, hasta el punto que tengo que reiniciar de nuevo. Cuando funciona, he de evitar abrir páginas PDF, pues se bloquea TODO EL SISTEMA, no me queda mas remedio que resetear, por las bravas. Y va bastante mas lento e impreciso. 

Todo eso en cuanto al 113. Actualmente, solo consigo mantener estable el 112 primera versión, con una configuración antigua, marcadores desactualizados (faltan algunos), y he tenido que instalar un par de extensiones que habían desaparecido. Por lo demás, de momento va bien, pero imagino que esta versión no tendrá todas las medidas de seguridad actualizadas. Ademas en un principio, solo me aparecía en inglés, aunque ahora he conseguido que la versión en castellano funcione y sea estable (con mi configuración). Nada mas, espero que se arregle lo antes posible para estar actualizado y seguro. Parece que hay mas gente que le pasa algo parecido por lo que he leído en los foros. Hasta pronto.
creator: andrejkassovick16

title: Web page not displaying correctly
content:
Hi,

I've recently joined a new flight sim website - virtualflight.online.

One of their pages opens a world map and places real-time icons on that map to show the exact locations of fellow 'simmers'. If the page is scrolled down, then one is able to view various details of all of the people logged-on, and, clicking on any one person takes you back to the map (very zoomed in) at their precise location.

My problem is that on two of my Windows PCs this does not happen. When I log into the site I only see the world map but without any icons showing on it. However, if I scroll down the page I can still see listed all of the current users and, clicking on any one of them takes me back to the map (zoomed-in) and shows me (presumably) their location.

I have asked the question of virtualflight.online why this may be the case and was given the following answer 'The "who's online" is incompatible with Firefox - not sure why. I think it's to do with Firefox not implementing some of the scalable vector graphics interface properly.'

I would be grateful if you could give me some advice on this?

I also run Firefox on my iPhone and that opens up the web page exactly as it should and shows me immediately who is on-line and where they are 'flying'.  ???

Many thanks, Tony
creator: tony.farrington

title: Web address line autofill
content: Whenever you start typing a certain website name in the address bar, Firefox suggests and option to auto-fill the address based on what you've typed. My issue with that is that auto-fill keeps suggesting the address that I DON'T want it to. Specifically, I want "ya" to auto-fill to "ya.ru", instead it keeps suggesting "yandex.com.ge". Now, I have tried deleting all the history of ever going to "yandex.com.ge" as well as just ignoring the issue and typing out the full "ya.ru" by myself and giving Firefox some time to catch onto this, however after a couple of weeks nothing's changed. What's interesting is that when I type "ya" in the address bar, Firefox shows the following (in order): the wrong auto-fill suggestion ("yandex.com.ge"), some search suggestions (yahoo, yandex, yahoo mail, etc), then after the search suggestions there is a separator that says "Firefox suggests" and what do you think, the CORRECT auto-fill that I want is first right in there - "ya.ru". So Firefox actually knows that I want it, since it's the first thing in "Firefox suggests", but why can I not get it as a default auto-fill suggestion?

title: Firefox error on MacOS when accessing Google: NS_ERROR_DOM_COOP_FAILED
content:
About 50% of times when I'm trying to perform a Google search, I'm getting an error page saying "Blocked Page: An error occurred during a connection to www.google.com."

It always happens first on performing a search, regardless of content (eg: "Liverpool Milan 2005") The network tab says "NS_ERROR_DOM_COOP_FAILED"

It only ever happens on Google (and only with Firefox) and it seems temporary, though it can take hours to apparently fix itself. At the same time, any other browser (Chrome, Safari) works ok with the same query.

title: Youtube em tela cheia esta com bordas
content:
Estou com bordas quando coloco meus vídeos em tela cheia no YouTube, e isto só esta acontecendo no Firefox, testei em outros navegadores, e esta normal.

As bordas acontecem no lado direito e esquerdo e em baixo. Fica aparecendo as janelas e area de trabalho ali nessas bordas. É como se o vídeo não ficasse em tela cheia e ficasse faltando um pedaço de cada lado desses.

Já tentei tirar a única extensão que eu uso, mas continua o mesmo problema. Tentei reinstalar completamente, fazer uma instalação limpa, desinstalar apagar tudo que tem do Firefox no pc e reiniciar, baixar ultima versão e instalar, mas mesmo assim o problema ainda persiste.

Queria uma solução para este problema/bug, pois o Firefox é meu navegador padrão e uso muito ele...

Irei deixar imagem anexada em baixo.

Obg desde já.

creator: butlerjonas

title: mise à jour
content: J'utilise FF depuis qu'il existe. Avant, dans les paramètres, on avait des options pour les mises à jour. Je choisissais toujours « me demander avant d'installer mises à jour ». Depuis 2 ans, j'utilise linux. FF est installé par défaut sur Linux. Quand je veux choisir pour PARAMÉTRER les mises à jour, il n'y a aucun choix. J'ouvre souvent plusieurs fenêtres en même temps dans FF, pour les lire plus tard. Mais FF me dit de redémarer FF parce qu'il a installé des mises à jour !!! Parce que je navigue toujours en «privé», ces pages ne sont pas rouvertes au redémarrage de FF. Donc je perds beaucoup de temps, souvent au milieu d'un travail important, pARCE QUE JE DOIS RÉOUVRIR TOUTES MES PAGES ! ET IL FAIT CES MISES À JOUR DE FAÇON ALÉATOIRE, À N'IMPORTE QUELLE HEURE DU JOUR OU DE LA NUIT ! Donc je demande que FF me redonne le choix dans les paramètres. Je ne veux pas que FF installe les mises à jour quand il le décide, sans tenir compte de mon travail en cours. Ou y-a-t-il une version plus nouvelle qui permet ces choix ? Merci d'avance pour une réponse rapide. Anne
creator: annbess
